text: we've already spent money erecting the
border fence around the port at Calais
we're putting in place the border fence
at kokal outside the tunnel
the French are sending an extra hundred
and twenty police everything that can be
done will be done to make sure our
borders are secure and make sure that
British holidaymakers are able to go on
their holidays deserts and seas to get
here to get to Britain do you sympathize
with well what I would say is that we
have to keep our borders secure that
means taking action at the border it
means taking advantage of the fact that
our border controls are actually on the
French side which is a great advantage
for our nation but also yes no no what
it also means is we have to deal with
the problem at source and that is
stopping so many people from travelling
across the Mediterranean in search of a
better life now that means doing
everything from trying to stabilise the
countries from which they come
it also means breaking the link between
traveling and getting the right to stay
in Europe and frankly yes it also means
in our own country as I've done as Prime
Minister
making sure it's less easy for illegal
migrants to stay in Britain that's why
we're passing legislation we've done
this very recently to make sure you
can't get a driving licence you can't
rent a house you can't take out a bank
account and that we will remove more
illegal migrants from our country so
people know it's not a safe haven once
you get bigger problem - and aren't we
paying the price we're not tackling this
issue at source in Italy where these
migrants were arriving shouldn't we be
doing more to help them how's the
process that turned around us in the
back well we are contributing to the
operation in the Mediterranean to pick
people up we are helping the Italians in
Italy with their Asylum system but the
fact is people want to come to Britain
because we've created so many jobs and
cuz we're such a great country to live
in now the answer to that is to
strengthen our border controls remove
more illegal migrants go after the
illegal gangs that are bringing these
people here and often then sort of
bringing them to Britain and often
making them live in poor conditions all
of those things we are doing is it
testing yes of
course it is but as the government
totally focused on it working with the
French yes we are
